name: Dog Park at Capital Springs Recreation Area
description: Bring Fido to blow off some steam at the dog park at Capital Springs Recreation Area in Madison, WI.  This fenced off-leash pup recreation space features separate sections for small and large dogs, trees and trails. An annual park permit or a small daily fee is required.

name: Granville Dog Park
description: Granville Dog Park in Milwaukee, WI is a fee-based park. With the purchase of a day pass or annual membership, Fido can explore this expansive park which features grassy hills, wooded areas and narrow walking trails along the Menomonee River. Unlike many off-leash areas, Granville Dog Park does not have wide open spaces for Fido to run around in clear sight of his owner.

name: Kaukauna Dog Park
description: The 13-acre Kaukauna Dog Park, located in Kaukauna, WI, contains three separate grassy areas. There is a fenced-in small dog area, a very large fenced-in area for all dogs and a fenced-in pond where dogs can swim. You can also check out the walking trail around the perimeter of the pond, which includes two bridges built by local Boy Scouts. The park is well-lit after dark and there are soda machines available for thirsty dog owners.

name: Dog Park at Prairie Moraine County Park
description: Bring Fido to the dog park at Prairie Moraine County Park in Verona, WI. This 79-acre off-leash pup recreation area is known for being the best in the surrounding area, as it features tons of trails, grassy meadows with big hills, prairie grass, beautiful wildflowers and open space for your pup to run and explore. There are disposal bags, benches and picnic tables available for humans. A permit is required.

name: White River Dog Park
description: Bring Fido to expend his energy with friends at White River Dog Park in Lake Geneva, WI. The park is located behind Eastview Elementary School and opposite Lake Geneva Skatepark. The dog park is fully fenced and features water fountains for both humans and dogs, a bone shaped bench, shaded areas and pet waste stations.

name: Room to Roam Dog Park of Rome
description: Fido is invited to play at Room To Roam Dog Park of Rome in Nekoosa, WI. Dogs of all sizes are welcome to play in this 9.8-acre space. Amenities include a walking path, benches, water and waste stations, and agility equipment.

name: Minooka Dog Park
description: Bring Fido to Minooka Dog Park, a large 19-acre off-leash park in Waukesha, WI. This fenced park has two separate enclosed areas for large and small breeds. There is no water on site, so owners should bring water and a bowl for Fido. Please note that this park can become muddy after periods of wet weather.

name: The Boneyard
description: The Boneyard in Madison, WI, is a dog park with the joys of a biergarten, featuring on-and-off-leash recreation for dogs and humans to enjoy together. While you hang out, the Boneyard's "Barktenders" will pull you a pint from 16 taps that include beer, coffee, wine and more. A day pass or annual membership is required. Dog owners must sign an electronic waiver on the website before bringing Fido to the beer garden.

name: Tails & Trails Off-Leash Dog Park
description: Dogs can enjoy off-leash play with paid admission at the Tails & Trails Off-Leash Dog Park in Waupaca, WI. The park offers walking trails and a large swimming pond. Annual memberships and day passes are available.

name: The Hounds & Tap
description: With a daily or monthly dog membership, dogs can play year-round in an off-leash, 2,500 sq ft. indoor or 5,500 sq ft outdoor dog park while you relax with friends, drink with your furry friend, watch the game, relax and meet other dog lovers. There are separate large and small dog areas for playing. Pups can get their sniff on in the exclusive K9Grass area or romp on the play equipment. Doggie pools available during the summer. Beer, wine, fun cocktails, water and soda are available for the humans.

name: Shiloh Road Bark Park
description: Bring Fido to the Shiloh Road Bark Park in Sturgeon Bay, WI, which features separate areas for large and small dogs and benches for humans.

name: Chippewa Falls HappyTails Dog Park
description: Fido is invited to play at Chippewa Falls HappyTails Dog Park in Wisconsin. The off-leash facility has over 53 acres with three different sections for dogs of all sizes. Amenities include a watering hole, benches with shade and pathways surrounding the area. The park is maintained and run by volunteers who operate on donations.

name: McFarland Dog Park
description: Bring Fido to McFarland Dog Park, an off-leash fenced space in McFarland, WI. The park features an enclosed shelter, a heated, indoor washing station, a seasonal outdoor washing station, restrooms, and plenty of shade from mature trees. Your dog must be licensed, and a permit is required, which to use the park.

name: Brown County Dog Park
description: Brown County Dog Park is a great place for Fido run and play off leash in Hobart, WI. It's fully fenced with and grass covered with dirt patches, wooded areas, and water access. The park features separate spaces for large and small dogs, as well as one combined. Amenities include trails, a creek, agility obstacles, handicap access, benches, water fountains, waste stations, and restrooms nearby. Park passes are required. Dog owners may walk their dogs on-leash through the rest of the park.

name: Shepard Dog Park
description: Dogs love playing off-leash at Shepard Dog Park in Rhinelander, WI. The fenced-in area is great for bringing your pup to socialize and exercise. Two separate sections for small and large dogs include waste and water stations, toy boxes and benches. There is also a walking path within the park that is shaded by large evergreen trees.

name: Three Lakes Dog Park
description: Three Lakes Dog Park in Three Lakes, WI, is 2 acres is size and has separate areas for small and large dogs. Dogs must be vaccinated to use the park. Visitors will find running water during the warmer months, restrooms, a dog wash area, a pavilion, and dog waste stations.

name: Auggie Land
description: Bring Fido to blow off some steam at the Auggie Land dog park in Chetek, WI. This pup recreation space features separate sections for small and large dogs, plenty of space to run, agility equipment, a pavilion and a dog wash.

name: Terri Tinsley Dog Exercise Area
description: Fido is invited to play at Terri Tinsley Dog Exercise Area, off Highway 26, in Johnson Creek, WI. The park is 109 acres and has two large and small dog areas. A daily permit or annual tag is required to entire the off-leash facility. Please refer to their website on how to become a member.

name: Viking County Park Dog Park
description: Your pet will go wild for the fenced-in and off-leash dog park at Viking County Park in Stoughton, WI, which includes a dock and beach where your pet can go for a dip, as well as paths and picnic tables.

name: Northland Dog Park
description: Fido is invited to play at Northland Dog Park in Appleton, WI. This fenced off-leash facility provides three separate sections, including a wooded 12 acres with walking trails and a small and large dog area. Waste stations are offered on-site, but it's encouraged to bring your own along with water for your pup.

name: Platteville Community Dog Park
description: Nestled against the Rountree Branch stream in Platteville, WI, the five-acre Platteville Community Dog Park provides a safe and spacious area for dogs to frolic and play. It's a fenced-in off-leash area, with separate sections for small and large dogs, a wooded walking path, poop disposal stations, picnic tables, parking and a porta-potty.

name: Waupaca County Dog Park
description: Shade trees, benches, picnic tables, and agility equipment are amenities of the Waupaca County Dog Park. This two-acre fenced-in recreation space is a local favorite among the Waupaca, WI, community.

name: Dog Park at Yahara Heights County Park
description: Dogs can play off leash in the 20-acre dog park at Yahara Heights County Park in Waunakee, WI, which features ample grassy space and water for Fido to dip his paws into. Please note dog permits are required.

name: Tails n Trails Dog Park
description: Fido is invited to play at the Tails n Trails Dog Park in Milton, WI. This off-leash facility has two separate areas for small and large dogs. Amenities include water, a walking trail and off-street parking.

name: Burlington Dog Park
description: Fido is invited to play at Burlington Dog Park in Wisconsin. Dogs of all sizes are welcome to join for socialization. Amenities include chairs along with a waste and water station.

name: Merrill Dog Park at the MARC
description: Fido is invited to play at the Merrill Dog Park at the MARC in Wisconsin. The off-leash area is 2.5 acres and features a separate section for small dogs. If the park is busy, they have pathways connecting to Council Grounds State Park.

name: Laura & Peter Mossakowski Family Dog Park
description: Fido will love playing at the Laura & Peter Mossakowski Family Dog Park in Bellevue, WI. This 6.5-acre recreation space is a place where furry friends have a place to run, roll around in the mud, meet new four-legged friends and even catch a ball or a Frisbee. Note that permits are required to use this dog park.

name: Paws & Play Dog Park
description: Paws & Play Dog Park is a 4.5-acre fenced-in area in Marshfield, WI. The park is relied on donations and has two separate areas for small and large dogs. Amenities include waste stations, picnic tables and water during the warmer months.

name: Off-Leash Dog Area at Mead Park
description: Fido is invited to play at the off-leash dog area at Mead Park in Stevens Point, WI. The beach opens 30 minutes before sunrise, and your furry friend can play until 11:00 PM daily. Owners must be within the fenced-in area with a leash readily available while watching their pup. Park users without an animal may also use this beach.

name: Hudson Dog Park
description: Bring Fido to blow off some steam at the Hudson Dog Park in Hudson, WI. This two-acre pup recreation area is fully fenced and has waste bags on site. All dogs must be licensed in the municipality where the owner and pet reside.

name: The City of Superior Dog Park
description: Fido is invited to play at The City of Superior Dog Park near the Millennium Trailhead in Wisconsin. This off-leash area has a two-way entrance and various trees spread throughout for shade. Amenities also include benches and waste stations.

name: Bark & Brew
description: Bark & Brew is a pet-friendly spot in Howard, WI. The first of its kind, this off-leash, indoor/outdoor, climate-controlled establishment has a dog menu and delicious beverages for humans. Though they do not sell human food, you can bring in your own or have it delivered from your favorite takeout spot!

name: Sister Bay Dog Park
description: If Fido needs a place to stretch his legs, bring him for a romp at the Sister Bay Dog Park in Sister Bay, WI. Entirely fenced in and equipped with picnic tables and mutt mitts, the park is open year-round, from dawn until dusk, and is free to the public.

name: River Falls Dog Park
description: Bring your pup to socialize and get some exercise at the River Falls Dog Park in River Falls, WI. This 16-acre fenced off-leash pup recreation area features separate sections for small and large dogs, picnic tables, benches and dog waste stations. No running water is available, so make sure to bring some for Fido! There is plenty of parking on site.

name: Point Dog Park
description: Fido is invited to play at Point Dog Park in Stevens Point, WI. The off-leash facility contains two separate sections that are approximately 30 acres. Amenities include trails, wooded areas, benches and waste stations.

name: Spring Green Dog Park
description: Bring Fido to blow off some steam at the Spring Green Dog Park in Spring Green, WI. This off-leash pup recreation area features separate sections for small and large dogs, and is a great place to bring your pooch to play, have fun and make some new friends. Dog owners are reminded to keep an eye on their pup as they play and to clean up any mess that they leave behind.

name: Florence Bark Park
description: Bring your pup to the Florence Bark Park, a one-acre fenced-in off-leash dog park in Florence, WI. There are benches for humans and plenty of space for your pup to run, socialize and get some exercise.

name: Webster Community Dog Park
description: Fido is invited to play at the Webster Community Dog Park in Wisconsin. This off-leash facility has two separate sections for small and large dogs and a training area. Amenities include waste stations and double-gated entrances for safety.

name: Viroqua Bark Park
description: Fido is invited to play at Viroqua Bark Park in Wisconsin. The off-leash facility is separated into two sections for large and small dogs. Amenities include solar lights, picnic tables and benches. Please note there is no water source in this park, so pack some for your pup.

name: Marvin & Marie Schweer's Dog Park
description: Marvin & Marie Schweer's Dog Park is an off-leash recreation space in DeForest, WI. The park ensures pups play safely and comfortably with two separate fenced-in areas for large and small dogs. The park is free for residents, but visitors may pay a one-time or annual fee to let Fido play.

name: Dog Exercise Area at Standing Rocks Park
description: If a member, Fido is welcome to play at the dog exercise area at Standing Rocks Park in Stevens Point, WI. Your pup will go wild for the chance to run and play off-leash on the 32 fenced-in acres. Please refer to their website on how to become a member.

name: Bark & Brew
description: The pet-friendly Bark & Brew in Green Bay, WI, is the state's first dog bar, featuring off-leash indoor fun and a spacious fenced outdoor area for pups. Humans 21 and up can enjoy over 70 craft beers, cocktails, wine, and more, while Dog Butlers keep tails wagging with playtime, fresh water, and treats from the Bone Bar.

name: West Bend Dog Park
description: If a member, Fido is invited to play at West Bend Dog Park in Wisconsin. Your leashed furry friend will love exploring 10 acres that is completely fenced in. Amenities include ample parking, waste stations, hiking trails, benches and trees. Please note you must pack your own water.

name: Estabrook Dog Park
description: Estabrook Dog Park in Milwaukee, WI is a fee-based park. With purchase of a day pass or annual membership, Fido can explore Estabrook Dog Park and enjoy playing off leash with his friends. The park is situated within Estabrook Park and sits alongside the Oak Leaf Trail. This 3-acre park has a separate area for small dogs, and the ground is a mixture of grass and wood chips.

name: Nashotah Dog Park
street: W330 N5113 County Trunk Hwy C
description: Fido is invited to play at Nashotah Dog Park in Wisconsin. The off-leash section is separated for large and small breeds. Each area contains walking trails and watering stations for your pup.

name: Mukwonago Dog Exercise Park
description: Mukwonago Dog Exercise Park is a spacious 34-acre area in Mukwonago, WI, which is designated for off leash play. There are dog watering stations on the site, and three separately-fenced areas for large and small breeds, and a 'Lazy Bones Zone' for senior, shy, disabled or low energy pets.

name: Bay View Dog Park
street: E Lincoln Ave at S Bay St
description: Bay View Dog Park is a fee-based park in Milwaukee, WI. With purchase of a day pass or annual membership, Fido can explore Bay View Dog Park and enjoy playing off leash with his friends. The park comprises of one fenced area for dogs of all sizes, and there is communal watering area on site.

name: Palmer Park Off-Leash Dog Area
description: Fido is welcome to play, exercise, and explore within the off-leash dog area at Palmer Park in Janesville, WI. From 5:00 AM - 11:00 PM year-round, this designated area welcomes pups to visit with their owners. Except in established dog exercise areas, pets are prohibited from Janesville parks and trails between May 15th and September 15th of each year. Note that this space is not fully fenced.

name: City of New Richmond Off Leash Dog Park
description: The City of New Richmond Off Leash Dog Park, located in New Richmond, WI, is an 11.5-acre fenced recreation spot with mowed trails and benches. Make sure to bring water!

name: Katherine Kearney Carpenter Park
description: Fido is invited to play at the pet-friendly Katherine Kearney Carpenter Park in Mequon, WI. Your pup is welcome to explore off-leash around the various trails. The park, in total, is 35 acres.

name: Zander Dog Park
description: Bring Fido out for a day of play at Zander Dog Park in Two Rivers, WI! The area is fully fenced and grass covered with shady trees, picnic tables, benches, and waste stations. Don't forget water for your pup.

name: Otter Creek Off-Leash Dog Park
description: If a member, Fido is invited to play at the Otter Creek Off-Leash Dog Park in Eau Claire, WI. The large off-leash area welcomes dogs of all sizes to play. Amenities include benches, trees for shade and water available for dogs from May until October. Please refer to their website for acquiring a membership or daily permit.

name: Northwoods Humane Society Bark Park
description: The Northwoods Humane Society in Hayward, WI, features 87 beautiful acres that include two miles of walking trails, an outdoor pavilion for meetings, picnics and gatherings, and the Bark Park.  The Bark Park consists of two outdoor dog parks, one park for large dogs and a separate park for small dogs.  Both are open to the community.

name: Paws & Play Dog Park
description: Dogs are welcome to run and play off leash in the grassy, fenced Paws & Play Dog Park in Manitowoc, WI. From this location, visitors and their pups can also enjoy beach access or take a path out to Manitowoc North Breakwater Lighthouse which is close by.

name: Karen A. Nelson Memorial Dog Park
description: Karen A. Nelson Memorial Dog Park is located off Highway 38, just north of Racine, WI. Allow Fido to play at this fenced 4-acre off-leash park. The park has two separate areas for large and small dogs, picnic tables, and pet waste stations. There is no water on site so bringing water and a bowl for your dog is recommended.

name: Love's Travel Stop
description: Love's Travel Stop in Elkhorn, WI, is a dog-friendly gas station and rest area. Across America, you'll find Love's Travel Stops that offer facilities for traveling canines. This location has a fully-fenced dog park with a convenient waste station.

name: Lakeland Area Dog Park
description: Fido is invited to play at Lakeland Area Dog Park in Minocqua, WI. This off-leash facility has two separate areas for small and large dogs, totaling 1.65 acres. Amenities include benches, trees for shade and a water fountain. Donations are appreciated to help maintain the park.

name: FIDO Dog Park
description: Dogs are welcome to play at FIDO Dog Park in Fond du Lac, WI. This off-leash facility was donated to the City by a power company for dogs of all sizes, with amenities such as benches, picnic tables and chairs. Please note this area is not entirely fenced in.

name: East Troy Dog Park
description: East Troy Dog Park is located next to the municipal building in East Troy, WI. The park is open from sunrise to sunset and there are separate areas for small and large dogs. Please bring your own water.

name: Sunnyside Dog Park
description: Sunnyside Dog Park is a dog-friendly park in Fitchburg, WI. The large, grassy park is the perfect place for Fido enjoy a myriad of new scents or play endless rounds of fetch. There is ample parking and paths are accessible to wheelchairs. Benches and picnic tables are available. Additional features are planned as funds are raised, including agility equipment, leash holders, and hydration stations.

name: Ripon Dog Park
description: Ripon Dog Park is a fully-fenced off-leash recreation space in Ripon, WI, where Fido can play with his furry companions. The park is about five acres with separate areas for small and large dogs, providing plenty of room to run and play.

name: Warner Park Dog Park
description: Bring your pet to play at the 8-acre, partially fenced and off-leash dog park at Warner Park in Madison, WI. A daily or annual dog permit is required and may be purchased online or by calling (608) 266-4711.

name: Harris Family Dog Park
description: Harris Family Dog Park is a fee-based park in Kenosha, WI. With the purchase of an annual or day pass, Fido can access all off-leash parks in the Kenosha County Parks system. Harris Family Dog Park is a large grassy area within Old Settlers Park and features a water fountain, bench seating and shaded spaces.

name: Dog Park at Quann Park
description: Dogs will find loads of room to run and play off leash at the dog park at Quann Park in Madison, WI. Waste bag dispensers and water fountains are available on site. Be careful as the area is not fenced, and dog park permits are required.

name: Rice Lake Dog Park
description: Fido is invited to play at Rice Lake Dog Park in WI. Dogs of all sizes are welcome to roam off-leash in this 11.64-acre area. The park was created with the help of the Girl Scouts of Rice Lake.

name: Lakeside Park Dog Park
description: Fido is invited to play at the dog park at Lakeside Park in Fond du Lac, WI. This fenced-in area is located inside the 400-acre park, where your pup will love the chance to socialize off leash. Just remember to pack plenty of water for your outing.

name: Currie Dog Park
description: Currie Dog Park in Wauwatosa, WI is a fee-based park. With the purchase of a day pass or annual membership, Fido can explore Currie Dog Park and enjoy playing off leash with his friends. The park has enclosed separate areas for large and small dogs, as well as bench seating and pet waste stations. There is no water on site so bringing water and a bowl for your dog is recommended. A cash/self-pay station is located at the park entrance.

name: Dog Park at Badger Prairie County Park
description: The nine-acre, fenced, off-leash dog park at Badger Prairie County Park in Verona, WI is known for being clean and well-maintained. It also includes an agility area with two jumps and a tunnel. Please note permits are required for park use.

name: Howard Dog Park
description: Located in the Gordon Nauman Conservation Area in Green Bay, WI, the Howard Dog Park features a fully enclosed fenced area, a semi-fenced area in the woods, and a walking trail. The space is grass covered with dirt paths and wooded areas. Waste stations are available, but remember to bring water and a bowl for your pup.

name: Caledonia Dog Park
description: Caledonia Dog Park in Racine, WI is a spacious 28-acre off-leash dog park. Let Fido explore the wooded areas, splash in the pond, dart through the open fields, and cool off in the Root River with his canine companions.

name: Homestead Howl Dog Park
description: Fido is invited to play at Homestead Howl Dog Park in the Village of Germantown, WI. The off-leash facility features two separate sections for small and large dogs. The large dog area has an open field and a trail into the woods. Please note a fee is involved when entering the park.

name: Warren Close Bark Park
description: Warren Close Bark Park is a fee-based park in Twin Lakes, WI. With the purchase of an annual or day pass, Fido can access all off-leash parks in the Kenosha County Parks system. Warren Close Bark Park is located within Kenosha County Veterans Memorial Park and features separate enclosed areas for large and small dogs.

name: Menomonee Park Dog Exercise Area
description: Take Fido for a day of fun at the off-leash at the Menomonee Park Dog Exercise Area in Menomonee Falls, WI. The dog park is separated into three fenced sections providing dedicated areas for small, larger and senior dogs to play safely. Combined, the three areas cover more than 30 acres of land with maintained trails and water fountains.

name: Captain Bailey's Dog Park
description: Bring Fido to burn off some energy at Captain Bailey's Dog Park in Baileys Harbor, WI. This pup recreation area features small and large dog areas and is open from dawn until dusk.

name: Sun Prairie Pet Exercise Area
description: Your pet will thank you for the chance to play off leash at the fenced Sun Prairie Pet Exercise Area in Sun Prairie, WI, which includes a separate section for smaller dogs. Remember to bring water, and dog park permits are required. Dog park tags can be purchased at the City Clerk's Office.

name: Two Hearts Dog Park
description: Two Hearts Dog Park is a pet-friendly recreation area in Wasau, WI. This pretty park is divided into two separate sections, one for small pups and another for large dogs. Amenities include a drinking fountain, a pavilion, dog waste stations, agility equipment and ample parking. Two Hearts Dog Park is open every day of the week from dawn until dusk.

name: Paw Print Park
description: If a member, Fido is invited to play at Paw Print Park within Prairie Knoll Park in Janesville, WI. This off-leash facility is 16 acres and has two separate sections for small and large dogs. Amenities include waste stations, benches and a water hose. Please refer to their website on how to become a member.

name: Dog Park at Syverson Park
description: Bring Fido out for a day of play and exercise at Syverson Park's dog park in Westby, WI. It's fully fenced and grass covered with a couple shady trees, plus separate areas for large and small dogs. Benches and waste stations are available inside, and the surrounding park includes restrooms and a water fountain.

name: Van Riper Dog Park
description: If a member, Fido is invited to play at the Van Riper Dog Park in Onalaska, WI. The off-leash spacious facility provides a two-way gate system to help prevent accidental escapes. Amenities include a shaded seating area, agility equipment, water, doggie bags and various toys. Please refer to their website on how to become a member.

name: Harbor Hounds Dog Park
description: Bring Fido to Harbor Hounds Dog Park in Egg Harbor, WI. This fenced recreation area welcomes four-legged companions to play and exercise off leash in one of the two separate spaces for small and large dogs. Amenities of the park include a sizeable parking lot, pet waste stations and many shade trees.

name: Liston Dog Park
description: Bring your pup to blow off some steam at the Liston Dog Park in Baraboo, WI. This pup recreation area features separate sections for small and large dogs, agility equipment and a water fountain. A permit is required.

name: Winnabago County Dog Park
description: Fido is invited to play at Winnabago County Dog Park in Oshkosh, WI. This off-leash facility has 9-acres of space with a separate section for small dogs. Amenities include walking paths, waste stations and a water source available in the summer.

name: Bark Park
description: Bring Fido to Bark Park, an enclosed off-leash area at the northwest corner of Jefferson Street and Starin Road in Whitewater, WI. The park has two separate sections for large and small dogs, on-site parking, picnic tables, benches, trash receptacles, and convenient Mutt Mitts for easy clean up.

name: Dog Park at Sycamore Park
description: Dogs will find loads of room to run and play off leash in the large dog park at Sycamore Park in Madison, WI. Be careful as the area is not fenced, and dog park permits are required.

name: Carlisle Family Dog Park
description: Carlisle Family Dog Park is a fee-based park in Kenosha, WI. With the purchase of an annual or day pass, Fido can access all off-leash parks in the Kenosha County Parks system. Carlisle Family Dog Park is a large grassy area within Petrifying Springs Park and features a separate enclosed space for small dogs, agility obstacles, seating, and large shade trees.

name: Bark Park at Indian Creek Park
description: Pets love to play off leash at the Bark Park at Indian Creek Park in Manitowoc, WI. This pup recreation area features an agility course, trees and a creek to splash in. Be careful as the area is not fenced.

name: Dog Park at Brittingham Park
description: Pets will love to play off leash at the dog park at Brittingham Park in Madison, WI. Though, be careful, as it is not fenced. A permit is required.

name: Anderson Farm County Park Dog Park
description: Anderson Farm County Park Dog Park is pet-friendly. Mutts of Madison and the surrounding areas have a spot to trot in the nearby Village of Oregon. Anderson Farm County Park Dog Park is a 35-acre off-leash dog park divided into separate areas for small and large dogs. Walkers can enjoy the limestone trails that wind through the large fenced space and can pause for a snack at the edible orchard. You and your pooch can even stroll all the way to the park along a paved trail from the village.

name: Tomahawk Dog Park
description: Fido is invited to play at Tomahawk Dog Park in Wisconsin. The off-leash area contains 3-acres for large dogs and half an acre for small or shy dogs. Donations are appreciated to maintain the dog park.

name: Love's Travel Stop
description: Love's Travel Stop in Sheboygan, WI, is a dog-friendly gas station and rest area. Across America, you'll find Love's Travel Stops that offer facilities for traveling canines. This location has a fully-fenced dog park with a convenient waste station.

name: Millston Cenex
description: The Millston Cenex is a gas station in Millston, WI, with an off-leash dog park to the left of the building. The station is just off I-94, about an hour east of Eau Claire.

name: Ashland Dog Park
description: Four-legged friends are invited to play and socialize off leash at the Ashland Dog Park in Ashland, WI. This fenced recreation area features an approximately 2-acre grassy space with shade trees, picnic tables, double-gated entry, waste bags and trash receptacles.

name: Dog Park at Indian Lake County Park
description: The by-permit-only dog park at Indian Lake County Park in Cross Plains, WI, is a 42-acre recreation space where Fido can play with his pet companions. Located near the boat launch, this designated off-leash area for your furry friend welcomes pups of all sizes to explore together. Note that dogs require a permit before visiting the park. Dogs must be leashed when transitioning in and out of the space.

name: Dog Park at Token Creek County Park
description: Token Creek County Park in Madison, WI, features a by-permit-only, 38-acre dog park for Fido to play off-leash. The area includes a 5-acre area for small dogs. Walking trails and agility equipment are available in the park. Ensure dogs are leashed when entering and exiting the park, and note that permits are required to visit.

name: Dog Exercise Area at Mitchell Park
description: Fido is invited to play at the Dog Exercise Area at Mitchell Park in Brookfield, WI. This off-leash facility has two separate sections for small and large dogs. Your furry friend will also have access to a creek to dip in.

name: Doggieland Play Park LLC
description: Doggieland Play Park LLC is an indoor dog park where Fido can play with his pet companions! This play area in Madison, WI, allows owners to bring dogs to socialize off-leash in a safe and controlled environment. They also offer agility training, birthday parties, a pet wash station and more.

name: Ingram park
description: Bring Fido to the enclosed dog park within Ingram Park, located in Pleasant Prairie, WI. To access the park, Fido requires a daily or annual dog tag. A pay station on site can be used by those wishing to buy a daily tag for each visit, and annual passes can be purchased at the Village Hall. The dog park has separate areas for small and large dogs and is open from dawn until dusk.

name: Off-Leash Dog Area at Oak Island Park
description: Fido is invited to play during the off-leash dog area at Oakside Park in Wausau, WI. From 6:00 AM until 9:00 AM and 6:00 PM until 9:00 PM, your pup can run in the non-fenced area next to their boat launch. Various signs with maps are posted at the park indicating the boundaries.

name: Houska Dog Park
description: Fido is invited to play at Houska Dog Park in La Crosse, WI. The off-leash facility is 5 acres and welcomes dogs of all sizes. Amenities include drinking fountains, restrooms, adequate parking, agility equipment and bag dispensers.

name: Weston Dog Park
description: Fido is invited to play at Weston Dog Park in Wisconsin. The off-leash area is about 40 acres and offers a section for dog training. Amenities include an agility course, waste and watering stations, and walking paths.

name: Off-Leash Area at Rock River Parkway
street: S County Rd D & W Rockport Park Dr
description: Fido is invited to play at the off-leash area at Rock River Parkway in Janesville, WI. This designated spot allows you to train your pup without violating the leash law. Please note you must always have your dog under your control, clean up after them and ensure they have a license from your municipality.

name: Shamrock Dog Park
description: The shady and fenced two-acre Shamrock Dog Park has views of the river and is a beautiful place to take your pet for some off-leash exercise in Prairie du Sac, WI. A monthly or annual membership is required.

name: Muttland Meadows
description: Fido is invited to play at Muttland Meadows in Grafton, WI. This off-leash facility is 7 acres with authentic fire hydrants, original dog houses and trails. Dogs of all sizes are welcome.

name: Vital Essentials Dog Park
description: Vital Essentials Dog Park is a fenced space for Fido and fellow canines to play off leash in Green Bay, WI. Located in the Broadway District, this convenient park is a great space for you and your pup to socialize with other dogs and pet parents.

name: Dog Park at Myrick Park
description: Fido is invited to play at the dog park at Myrick Park in La Crosse, WI. The fenced-in area is relatively small but welcomes dogs of all sizes. After hitting the trails, it's a great stop to let your pup run off leash.

name: New London Jaycees Dog Park
description: The three-acre New London Jaycees Dog Park has two fenced-in areas to leisurely exercise your dog. There is a small dog area for dogs 25 pounds or less and a large fenced area suitable for dogs over 25 pounds. This recreation space is a local favorite amongst dog owners in New London, WI, community. The park features waste stations, shade trees and benches for humans.

name: Off-Leash Dog Area at Riverside Park
description: Fido is invited to play at the off-leash dog area at Riverside Park in Wausau, WI. From 6:00 AM until 9:00 AM and 6:00 PM until 9:00 PM, your pup can run in the non-fenced area next to the Wisconsin River and their picnic island. Various signs with maps are posted at the park indicating the boundaries.

name: Sandy Paws Dog Park
description: Fido is invited to play at Sandy Paws Dog Park in West Bend, WI. This off-leash area contains two separate sections for small and large dogs and a back entrance leading to trails. The park is 9 acres and provides shelter and seating areas for pet parents.

name: Dog Park at Demetral Park
description: The dog park at Demetral Park, located in Madison, WI, is an approximately one-acre off-leash play space for dogs of all sizes.

name: City of Beloit Dog Park
description: City Of Beloit Dog Park is a great place to let your dog off the leash to run, play, and socialize. Located in Beloit, WI, the park is 2.5 acres and has two separately-fenced areas for large and small dogs. Dog owners are required to either pay the daily fee that will be placed in a drop-box at the entrance gate or purchase an Annual Dog Tag that can be worn by their pet.

name: City of Chetek Dog Park
description: Fido is invited to play at the City of Chetek Dog Park in Wisconsin. The off-leash facility features a separate small dog area. Amenities include trees for shade and picnic tables. The park relies on donations for maintenance.

name: Ripp Park Pet Exercise Area
description: Bring your pup to the fenced Ripp Park Pet Exercise Area in Waunakee, WI to get some off-leash exercise. Dog owners are reminded to clean up any mess that is left behind by their pups.

name: Off-Leash Dog Area at Memorial Park
description: Fido is invited to play during the off-leash dog area at Memorial Park in Wausau, WI. From 6:00 AM until 9:00 AM, your pup can run in the non-fenced area behind the skate park. Various signs with maps are posted at the park indicating the boundaries.

name: Love's Travel Stop
description: Love's Travel Stop in Oak Creek, WI, is a dog-friendly gas station and rest area. Across America, you'll find Love's Travel Stops that offer facilities for traveling canines. This location has a fully-fenced dog park with a convenient waste station.

name: Love's Truck Stop
description: Love's Travel Stop in Menomonie, WI, is a dog-friendly gas station and rest area. Across America, you'll find Love's Travel Stops that offer facilities for traveling canines. This location has a fully-fenced dog park with a convenient waste station.

name: Merry Mutts Play Yard
description: Merry Mutts Play Yard is an off-leash space for you and your dog in Casco, WI. The park runs on a self-service scheduling system. You and your pooch can enjoy a play session at this pleasant park, which includes agility equipment, a fence around the outside and luscious grassy patches. Dog owners are reminded to clean up after their pups, and there is an admission fee to access the park.

name: Sundet Off-Leash Dog Park
description: Sundet Off-Leash Dog Park in Eau Claire, WI, welcomes licensed dogs to run and play between dawn and dusk daily. Annual dog licenses and dog park licenses are required and can be purchased in person or online. Passes are also valid at Otter Creek Off-Leash Dog Park. Larger dogs will love the 8.2 acre fenced play area and smaller dogs have a separate 1 acre fenced plot.

name: Antigo Dog Park
description: Fido is invited to play at Antigo Dog Park in Wisconsin. This off-leash area is 17 acres and provides a separate small dog area. Amenities include various access gates to enter and exit the park, along with trails and open spaces that are mowed throughout the summer.

name: Racine Petro
description: Conveniently located right alongside Highway 94 in Sturtevant, WI, is pet-friendly gas station Racine Petro. Fido is welcome to be off leash in the small fully-fenced dog park on the east side of the truck stop. Let you dog expend their energy before resuming your travels. Leashes are not required but dogs must be wearing a collar or harness, remain under control, and be supervised when in the dog park.

name: Ladysmith Leash-Free Dog Park
description: Fido is invited to play at Ladysmith Leash-Free Dog Park in Wisconsin. Dogs of all sizes are welcome to join to socialize and burn off energy. A picnic table is available on site.

name: Anderson Farm County Park
description: More than 300 acres of prairies, agriculture fields and woodland trails make up Anderson Farm County Park in Oregon, WI. This pet-friendly recreation area has a network of trails that connects Memorial Woods and the Village of Oregon with a large dog park. Fido is welcome to join you as your hiking buddy, but dogs must be kept on a leash.

name: Catalano Square
description: Leashed dogs are welcome to join you for a picnic at pet-friendly Catalano Square in Milwaukee, WI. This small but beloved community park, located in the popular Historic Third Ward, features a grassy lawn, benches and a fountain. It's also home to a refurbished vintage bus shelter and an urban amphitheater.

name: Zoila's Zone
description: Richfield, WI, is home to Zoila's Zone, a private indoor dog park where four-legged friends can play and socialize. Visitors can reserve 30- or 60-minute play sessions in the 1,200 sq ft, climate-controlled play space to ensure their furry companion gets some exercise. Note that an entrance fee does apply.

name: Wells Point Dog Park
description: Wells Point Dog Park welcomes small and large dogs in Montello, WI. The fenced park is available for off-leash play. There is a dog waste station on site.

name: Mac's Bark Park
description: Fido is invited to play Mac's Bark Park, an indoor off-leash facility in Milwaukee, WI. They aim to provide a safe place, tools and resources to deepen your bond with your dog. The park includes an agility course, toys, balls and more. Open or private play is available. Please note only two dogs per adult.

name: Love's Travel Stop
description: Love's Travel Stop in Fond du Lac, WI, is a dog-friendly gas station and rest area. Across America, you'll find Love's Travel Stops that offer facilities for traveling canines. This location has a fully-fenced dog park with a convenient waste station.

name: Maunesha River Dog Park
description: Maunesha River Dog Park is a fenced recreation area in Waterloo, WI. Within this community dog park, furry friends can enjoy off-leash fun in separate areas for small and large canines. Other access points include off Mill St or the public parking lot located off Madison St.

name: Cassville Dog Park
description: Take Fido to run, play and make new friends at Cassville Dog Park in Cassville, WI. This off-leash park features plenty of room and fluffy grass. The dog park is furnished with a large, covered pavilion, water stations and a ramp for agility. Please bring your own waste bags and clean up after Fido.

name: Penni Klein Dog Exercise Area
description: Bring Fido to blow off some steam at the Penni Klein Dog Exercise Area in Middleton, WI. This pet-friendly pup recreation area is fenced-in and features plenty of grassy space for your pup to run and play.

name: Spooner Dog Park
description: Bring Fido to Spooner Dog Park, a dog-friendly open space in Spooner, WI. Located across from Washburn County Humane Society and alongside the Wild Rivers Trail, dogs can enjoy off-leash exercise in a fully-fenced area. The enclosed space has agility equipment, dog waste stations, and a bench for owners to rest while Fido is at play.

name: River Run Dog Park
description: Bring Fido to River Run Dog Park in Columbus, WI. This local recreation area spans six acres and features wooded areas, benches, and gated river access for dogs to swim and play. A separate gated section is available for pets with special needs, making it a welcoming space for all pups to enjoy.

name: Jerry Finch Winnebago County Dog Park
description: Bring Fido to enjoy some off-leash fun at the Jerry Finch Winnebago County Dog Park in Neenah, WI.   Amenities of this 4.5-acre park include an open field, a wooded section, walking paths, waste bags, benches, and a porta-potty. This recreation space also offers a separate area for small pups.

name: Rapids Room to Zoom Dog Park
description: Dogs can play, run, and explore at Rapids Room to Zoom Dog Park in Wisconsin Rapids, WI. The 10-acre recreation space features separate areas for small and large pups, as well as shade trees, picnic tables, water, waste stations, and a walking trail. Dogs should be leashed when entering and exiting the park.

name: Menomonie Dog Park
description: Fido is invited to play at Menomonie Dog Park in Wisconsin. This off-leash facility has two separate sections for large and small dogs. Amenities include benches, a walking path and a trash can.

name: Dog Park at Halvorsen Park
description: Fido is invited to play at the dog park at Halvorsen Park in Manitowoc, WI. The area offers two fenced-in areas separated by pups under 35 lbs and one for larger dogs. Each section includes training structures, such as ramps and tunnels. A dog bubbler and waste bags are also available at the park.

name: Dog Park at McCormick Park
description: Bring Fido to blow off some steam at the dog park at McCormick Park in Madison, WI. This fenced off-leash pup recreation area features waste bag dispensers and benches for humans.

name: Warnimont Park Dog Park
description: If a member, Fido is invited to play at Warnimont Park Dog Park in Cudahy, WI. This off-leash area is 5 acres and has two separate sections for small and large dogs. Amenities include wooded trails, waste stations and trees for shade.

name: Love's Travel Stop
description: Love's Travel Stop in Poynette, WI, is a dog-friendly gas station and rest area. Across America, you'll find Love's Travel Stops that offer facilities for traveling canines. This location has a fully-fenced dog park with a convenient waste station.
